meanings.definition: Tensed: feeling or showing nervousness or anxiety
meanings.sent1: She looked tensed before the big exam.
meanings.sent2: His tensed expression revealed his worry.
meanings.sent3: The cat's tensed stance made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The silence in the room was so tensed, you could almost hear it.
meanings.sent5: The tensed atmosphere in the waiting room was palpable.

meanings.definition: Tensed: to make or become tense or taut
meanings.sent1: He tensed his muscles before lifting the heavy box.
meanings.sent2: The rope tensed as he pulled it tight.
meanings.sent3: She tensed the string of the bow, ready to shoot.
meanings.sent4: The situation tensed up as the argument escalated.
meanings.sent5: The air tensed with anticipation as the clock ticked closer to midnight.
